{{Video game release|JP|April 24, 2017 (nationwide)}} }} {{Infobox animanga/Other | title = Anime | content = *''[[Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation]]'' }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{nihongo|'''''Gunslinger Stratos'''''|ガンスリンガー ストラトス|Gansuringā Sutoratosu}} is a series of [[Third-person shooter|third-person]] [[hero shooter]] video games, developed by Byking and [[Taito]], and published by [[Square Enix]]. It debuted in [[Arcade game|arcades]] on July 12, 2012, with the scenario provided by Norimitsu Kaihō (from [[Nitroplus]]) based on a concept by [[Gen Urobuchi]].{{cite web|url=http://www.inside-games.jp/article/2014/02/20/74525.html|title=＜急募＞世界を守るだけの簡単なお仕事なっしー！ 虚淵玄原案の『ガンスリンガー ストラトス2』稼働開始 ― 記念イベントにはふなっしーも|newspaper=Inside|language=Japanese|date=February 20, 2014|accessdate=January 22, 2015}} It uses [[Silicon Studio]]'s Orochi [[game engine]],{{cite web|url=http://www.technologytell.com/gaming/88142/square-enix-next-game-is-gunslinger-stratos-uses-orochi-engine/ |title=Square Enix' next game is Gunslinger Stratos, uses Orochi Engine - GamerTell |newspaper=TechnologyTell |date= January 31, 2012 |accessdate=July 14, 2015}} and runs on the [[Taito Type X3|Taito Type X³]] [[arcade system board]]. Its sequel, {{nihongo|'''''Gunslinger Stratos 2'''''|ガンスリンガー ストラトス2|Gansuringā Sutoratosu 2}}, was released on February 20, 2014, featuring new characters, new battle mechanics, and new stages. [[Tetsuya Nomura]] and Akira Yasuda each created two characters exclusively for the game.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/11/03/tetsuya-nomura-street-fighter-character-designer-worked-square-enix-game/|title=Tetsuya Nomura And A Street Fighter Artist Worked On This Square Enix Game|date=November 3, 2013|website=Siliconera|accessdate=March 26, 2015}} A sequel, titled {{nihongo|'''''Gunslinger Stratos: Reloaded'''''|ガンスリンガー ストラトス リローデッド|Gansuringā Sutoratosu Rirōdeddo}}, was announced to be released in 2016 for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows PC]].{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-12-09/gunslinger-stratos-spawns-pc-online-game-magazine-manga/.81982|title=Gunslinger Stratos Spawns PC Online Game, Magazine, Manga|date=December 9, 2014|website=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=March 26, 2015}} The servers were closed on March 29, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://news.mmosite.com/content/2016-02-14/what_gunslinger_stratos_reloaded_is_shutting_down.shtml|title=What? Gunslinger Stratos Reloaded is Shutting Down!|date=February 14, 2016|newspaper=MMOSite|accessdate= July 25, 2016}} A fourth game, {{nihongo|'''''Gunslinger Stratos 3'''''|ガンスリンガー ストラトス3|Gansuringā Sutoratosu 3}}, was released on May 12, 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.famitsu.com/news/201511/21093445.html|title=『ガンスリンガー ストラトス3』ティザーPVやオードナー三兄妹の詳細ほか、最新情報が続々解禁！|date=November 21, 2015|newspaper=[[Famitsu]]|accessdate=November 21, 2015}} An upgraded version, {{nihongo|'''''Gunslinger Stratos Σ'''''|ガンスリンガー ストラトスΣ|Gansuringā Sutoratosu Σ}}, with four character types and six new weapon packs for each character and several changes to the respawn and awake systems, was released on April 24, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9KjsyE0sDds|title=『ガンスリンガー ストラトスΣ』プロモーションムービー|date=April 23, 2017|website=[[YouTube]]|accessdate= April 23, 2017}} An [[anime]] adaptation of the game known under its expanded title, ''[[Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation]]'', was announced and made its premiere on April 4, 2015.{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-12-09/square-enix-game-gunslinger-stratos-gets-tv-anime-in-2015/.81955|title=Square Enix Game Gunslinger Stratos Gets TV Anime in 2015|date=December 9, 2014|website=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=March 26, 2015}} ==Gameplay== All of the games are played from a [[Third-person (video games)|third-person]] perspective, and the player must move around the massive battleground (using the [[analog stick]]s and buttons on the two gun controllers), while using the [[Light gun|Gun Controllers]] to aim and shoot at enemies. The goal is to survive and shoot down the rival [[Team deathmatch|team]] to decrease the opposing team's team meter within a given time limit. The round ends when either teams' team meter drops to zero and/or if the timer reaches zero. Players can switch weapons in-battle, utilizing various strategies and tactics, by melding the two gun controllers together into different positions, such as: *Side Style: by clipping the side of the gun controllers together, the players can use their character's secondary arsenal. *Tandem Style: by clipping the tip of right gun controller onto the top of the left gun controller, the players can use their character's powerful arsenal. As the players progressed to the game's multiplayer mode, those who using the [[NESiCAxLive]] card can accumulate "Team Points" by winning battles, and using it to purchase and equip "Weapon Packs". Weapons Packs are a set of weapons that can be purchased and use in battle. Some of the packs has upgraded versions of the character's default weapons with boosted stats. ==Plot== ===Setting=== In 2115, the country known formerly as [[Japan]] has been split into two [[Multiverse|parallel worlds]]: the {{nihongo|''Frontier S (Stratos)''|フロンティアS（ストラトス）|Furontia S (sutoratosu)}} and the {{nihongo|''17th Far East Imperial City Management District''|第十七極東帝都管理区|Dai jū nana Kyokutō no teikoku kanri-ku}}. Frontier S is an outlaw universe in which freedom runs rampant, while the 17th Far East Imperial City Management District is a totalitarian universe completely bereft of freedom and is under constant surveillance. When the two universes are starting to fuse into one, the government of each worlds initiates the {{nihongo|''Operation Stratos''|オペレーション・ストラトス|Operēshon sutoratosu}}, a world-scale protocol wherein a handpicked group of [[gunslinger]]s, mercenaries, and special individuals, each from the two universes, will be sent in the year 2015 to alter the past by eliminating the other side until only one group survives, erasing a parallel universe in the process. ===Story=== The story revolves on a group of [[gunslinger]]s, each from the [[Multiverse|two universes]] who participate in Operation Stratos, particularly on a group of four childhood friends: Tohru Kazasumi, Kyōka Katagiri, Kyōma Katagiri, and Shizune Rindo, who all must confront their own flaws and differences when they battle their alternate selves in order to survive. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://gunslinger-stratos.jp/ ''Gunslinger Stratos'' official franchise website] * {{other uses|Jester (disambiguation)}} [[File:William Merritt Chase Keying up.jpg|thumb|''"Keying Up" – The Court Jester'' by [[William Merritt Chase]] ([[Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts]])]] A '''jester''', '''court jester''', or '''fool''', was historically an entertainer during the [[medieval]] and [[Renaissance]] eras who was a member of the household of a nobleman or a [[monarch]] employed to entertain him and his guests. A jester was also an itinerant performer who entertained common folk at fairs and markets. Jesters are also modern-day entertainers who resemble their historical counterparts. Jesters in medieval times are often thought to have worn brightly coloured clothes and [[Cap and bells|eccentric hats]] in a [[motley]] pattern and their modern counterparts usually mimic this costume. Jesters entertained with a wide variety of skills: principal among them were song, music, and [[storytelling]], but many also employed [[acrobatics]], [[juggling]], telling [[jokes]], and [[Magic (illusion)|magic tricks]]. Much of the entertainment was performed in a comic style and many jesters made contemporary jokes in word or song about people or events well known to their audiences. ==Etymology== The modern use of the English word ''jester'' did not come into use until the mid-16th century, during Tudor times.{{cite book|last=Soutworth|first=John|title=Fools and Jesters at the English Court|year=1998|publisher=Sutton Publishing|location=Stroud|isbn=0-7509-1773-3|pages=89–93}} This modern term derives from the older form ''gestour'', or ''jestour'', originally from Anglo-Norman (French) meaning ''story-teller'' or ''[[minstrel]]''. Other earlier terms included ''fol'', ''disour'', and ''bourder''. These terms described entertainers who differed in their skills and performances but who all shared many similarities in their role as comedic performers for their audiences.{{cite book|last=Welsford|first=Enid|title=The Fool: His Social & Literary History|year=1935|publisher=Faber & Faber|location=London|pages=114–115}}{{cite web|title=Jester|url=http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?allowed_in_frame=0&search=jester&searchmode=none|work=Online Etymology Dictionary|accessdate=28 October 2012}} ==History== Early jesters were popular in Ancient Egypt, and entertained Egyptian pharaohs. The [[ancient Rome|ancient Romans]] had a tradition of professional jesters, called ''[[balatro]]nes''.[[Horace|Hor]]. Sat. i. 2. 2. (cited by Allen) Balatrones were paid for their jests, and the tables of the wealthy were generally open to them for the sake of the amusement they afforded. Jesters were popular with the Aztec people in the 14th to 16th centuries.{{cite web| url= http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/212748/fool|title=Jester|publisher= Encyclopædia Britannica |accessdate=2012-06-07}} ===English royal court jesters=== [[File:WillSommers engraving 300dpi.jpg|thumb|left|upright|17th-century engraving of [[William Sommers|Will Sommers]], [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]]'s jester]] [[Image:Anthonis van Dyck 013.jpg|right|thumb|''Queen Henrietta Maria with Sir Jeffrey Hudson'' by [[Van Dyck]]]] Many [[Court (royal)|royal courts]] throughout English royal history employed entertainers and most had professional fools, sometimes called ''licensed fools''. Entertainment included [[early music|music]], [[storytelling]], and [[physical comedy]]. It has also been suggested they performed [[acrobatics]] and [[juggling]]. [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] of [[England]] employed a jester named [[William Sommers|Will Sommers]]. During the reigns of [[Elizabeth I of England|Elizabeth I]] and [[James I of England]], [[William Shakespeare]] wrote his plays and performed with his theatre company the [[Lord Chamberlain's Men]] (later called the [[King's Men (playing company)|King's Men]]). Clowns and jesters were featured in Shakespeare's plays, and the company's expert on jesting was [[Robert Armin]], author of the book ''Fooled upon Foole''. In Shakespeare's ''[[Twelfth Night]]'', [[Feste]] the jester is described as "wise enough to play the fool". [[File:"The Court Jester" (4540421737).jpg|thumb|upright|A court jester, carrying a [[marotte]], selected for the [[Pageant of Empire]] in 1909]] King [[James VI of Scotland]] employed a jester called [[Archibald Armstrong]]. During his lifetime Armstrong was given great honours at court. He was eventually thrown out of the King's employment when he over-reached and insulted too many influential people. Even after his disgrace, books telling of his jests were sold in London streets. He held some influence at court still in the reign of [[Charles I of England|Charles I]] and estates of land in [[Ireland]]. Charles later employed a jester called [[Jeffrey Hudson]] who was very popular and loyal. Jeffrey Hudson had the title of ''Royal [[Dwarfism|Dwarf]]'' because he was short of stature. One of his jests was to be presented hidden in a giant pie from which he would leap out. Hudson fought on the [[Cavalier|Royalist]] side in the [[English Civil War]]. A third jester associated with Charles I was called [[Muckle John]]. ==Political significance== [[File:Laughing Fool.jpg|thumb|upright|Laughing jester, unknown [[Early Netherlandish painting|Early Netherlandish]] artist (possibly [[Jacob Cornelisz van Oostsanen]]), circa 1500]] Scholar David Carlyon has cast doubt on the "daring political jester", calling historical tales "apocryphal", and concluding that "popular culture embraces a sentimental image of the clown; writers reproduce that sentimentality in the jester, and academics in the Trickster", but it "falters as analysis".{{cite journal |last=Carlyon |first=D. |year=2002 |title=The Trickster as Academic Comfort Food |journal=The Journal of American Culture |volume=25 |issue=1–2 |pages=14–18 |doi=10.1111/1542-734X.00003}} Jesters could also give bad news to the King that no one else would dare deliver. In 1340, when the French fleet was destroyed at the [[Battle of Sluys]] by the English. [[Phillippe VI]]'s jester told him the English sailors "don't even have the guts to jump into the water like our brave French".{{cite book |last=Otto |first=Beatrice K |title=Fools Are Everywhere: The Court Jester Around the World |publisher=[[University of Chicago Press]] |year=2001 |page=113}} ===End of tradition=== After the [[English Restoration|Restoration]], [[Charles II of England|Charles II]] did not reinstate the tradition of the court jester, but he did greatly patronize the theatre and proto-[[music hall]] entertainments, especially favouring the work of [[Thomas Killigrew]]. Though Killigrew was not officially a jester, [[Samuel Pepys]] in his famous diary does call Killigrew "The King's fool and jester, with the power to mock and revile even the most prominent without penalty" (12 February 1668). The last British nobles to keep jesters were the [[Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon|Queen Mother]]'s family, the Bowes-Lyons. In the 18th century, jesters had died out except in [[Russia]], [[Spain]] and [[Germany]]. In [[France]] and [[Italy]], travelling groups of jesters performed plays featuring stylized characters in a form of theatre called the ''[[commedia dell'arte]]''. A version of this passed into [[United Kingdom|British]] [[folk tradition]] in the form of a [[puppet]] show, ''[[Punch and Judy]]''. In France the tradition of the court jester ended with the [[French Revolution]]. In 1968, the [[Canada Council]] awarded a $3,500 grant to Joachim Foikis of [[Vancouver]] "to revive the ancient and time-honoured tradition of town fool".{{cite news|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/22907610/|date=May 14, 1968|title=The Corpus Christi Caller-Times|location=Corpus Christi, Texas|page=19}}{{cite web|url=http://considerthis.onlinedemocracy.ca/index.php?name=News&file=article&sid=345|title=Northumberland needs county jester to lighten up politics|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928112959/http://considerthis.onlinedemocracy.ca/index.php?name=News&file=article&sid=345|archivedate=Sep 28, 2007}} In the 21st century, the jester is still seen at medieval-style [[fair]]s and pageants. In 2015, the town of [[Conwy]] in [[North Wales]] appointed [[Russel Erwood]] (aka [[Erwyd le Fol]]) as the official resident jester of the town and its people, a post that had been vacant since 1295.{{Cite news|url=http://www.southwales-eveningpost.co.uk/jester-700-years/story-27536385-detail/story.html|title=Welsh medieval town unveils first jester-in-residence for 700 years|date=2015-08-03|newspaper=South Wales Evening Post|access-date=2016-10-14}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/welsh-town-appoints-official-jester-700-years-article-1.2316415|title=Welsh town appoints first official jester in 700 years|newspaper=NY Daily News|access-date=2016-10-14}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/russel-erwood-town-jester-conwy-9814519|title=This official town jester can balance a flaming barbecue on his head..!|last=Day|first=Liz|date=2015-08-08|newspaper=walesonline|access-date=2016-10-14}} ===Other countries=== [[File:Jan Matejko, Stańczyk.jpg|thumb|''[[Stańczyk (painting)|Stańczyk]]'', by [[Jan Matejko]].
[[Stańczyk|The Polish jester]] is the only person at a 1514 royal ball troubled by the news that the [[Russia]]ns have captured [[Smolensk]].]] [[Poland]]'s most famous court jester was [[Stańczyk]], whose jokes were usually related to political matters, and who later became a historical symbol for Poles.{{Cite book |agency= Wydawnictwo Lubelskie | location=Lublin | isbn = 978-83-222-0473-3 | author1 = Janusz Pelc| author2 = Paulina Buchwald-Pelcowa | author3 = Barbara Otwinowska | publisher = Instytut Badań Literackich, [[Polska Akademia Nauk]] | title = Jan Kochanowski 1584-1984: epoka, twórczość, recepcja | year = 1989 | pages=425–438|language=pl}}{{Cite journal | publisher = [[Państwowe Wydawnictwo Naukowe]] | location = Warsaw | editor = Jan Zygmunt Jakubowski | title = Przegląd humanistyczny | volume = 3 | year = 1959 | page = 200 |language=pl}} In 2004 [[English Heritage]] appointed [[Nigel Roder]] ("Kester the Jester") as the State Jester for England, the first since Muckle John 355 years previously.{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/3545218.stm | work=BBC News | title=Jesters joust for historic role | date=2004-08-08 | accessdate=2010-05-06}} However, following an objection by the National Guild of Jesters, English Heritage accepted they were not authorised to grant such a title.{{cite news|last=Griffiths |first=Emma |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/4120607.stm |title=England | Jesters get serious in name row |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-12-23 |accessdate=2012-07-11}} Roder was succeeded as "Heritage Jester" by Pete Cooper ("Peterkin the Fool").{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/4775661.stm |title=England | Jester completes 100-mile tribute |publisher=BBC News |date=2006-08-09 |accessdate=2012-07-11}} In [[Germany]], [[Till Eulenspiegel]] is a folkloric hero dating back to medieval times and ruling each year over [[Fasching]] or [[Carnival]] time, mocking politicians and public figures of power and authority with [[political satire]] like a modern-day court jester. He holds a mirror to make us aware of our times ([[Zeitgeist]]), and his [[sceptre]], his "bauble" or [[marotte]], is the symbol of his power. [[File:COLLECTIE TROPENMUSEUM Hofnar van de Soesoehoenan die meedanst in de 'Garebeg Moeloed' optocht Java TMnr 10003339.jpg|thumb|upright|left|[[Susuhunan]] jester who participates in the "Garebeg Moeloed" procession (circa 1920s), [[Java]], [[Indonesia]]]] In 17th century [[Spain]], [[Dwarfism|little people]], often with deformities, were employed as buffoons to entertain the king and his family, especially the children. In [[Diego Velázquez|Velázquez]]'s painting [[Las Meninas]] two dwarfs are included: Mari Bárbola a female dwarf from [[Germany]] with [[hydrocephalus]], and [[:es:Nicolasito Pertusato|Nicolasito Portusato]] from [[Italy]]. Mari Bárbola can also be seen in a later portrait of [[Margarita Teresa of Spain|princess Margarita Teresa]] in mourning by [[Juan Bautista Martinez del Mazo]]. There are other paintings by Velázquez that include court dwarves such as [[Prince Balthasar Charles With a Dwarf]]. In [[Japan]] from the 13th to 18th centuries, the ''[[taikomochi]]'', a kind of male [[geisha]], attended the feudal lords (''[[daimyō]]s''). They entertained mostly through dancing and storytelling, and were at times counted on for strategic advice. By the 16th century they fought alongside their lord in battle in addition to their other duties. [[Tonga]] was the first royal court to appoint a court jester in the 20th century; [[Taufa'ahau Tupou IV]], the King of Tonga, appointed [[Jesse Bogdonoff|JD Bogdanoff]] to that role in 1999.{{cite web |url=http://www.thenoodlebowl.com/jesters/images/reality/jddecree.jpg |format=JPEG |title=Tonga royal decree appointing JD Bogdanoff as court jester |accessdate=2009-10-29}} Bogdanoff was later embroiled in a financial scandal.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/3141297.stm |title=Tongan court jester faces trial |date=11 August 2003 |accessdate=2009-10-29 |publisher=BBC News}} ==The jester as a symbol== The root of the word "fool" is from the Latin ''follis'', which means "bag of wind" or bellows or that which contains air or breath.{{Cite web|url=http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=fool|title=Online Etymology Dictionary|website=www.etymonline.com|language=en|access-date=2017-03-30}} ===Fool in Tarot=== In [[Tarot cards|Tarot]], [[The Fool (Tarot card)|"The Fool"]] is a card of the [[Major Arcana]]. The tarot depiction of the Fool includes a man (or less often, a woman) [[juggling]] unconcernedly or otherwise distracted, often with a dog or cat at his heels. The fool is in the act of unknowingly walking off the edge of a cliff, precipice or other high place. (compare: [[Joker (playing card)]]). ===Fool in literature=== In literature, the jester is symbolic of common sense and of honesty, notably in ''[[King Lear]]'', where the court jester is a character used for insight and advice on the part of the monarch, taking advantage of his license to mock and speak freely to dispense frank observations and highlight the folly of his monarch. This presents a clashing irony as a greater man could dispense the same advice and find himself being detained in the dungeons or even executed. Only as the lowliest member of the court can the jester be the monarch's most useful adviser. Author [[Alan Gordon (author)|Alan Gordon]] also writes about jesters as advisers to the king, who actually make up a super-secret spy ring that try to keep peace and control the leaders of different countries. The Fool's Guild of these novels is portrayed as a mockery to the church, and they refer to [[Jesus Christ]] as "Their Savior, The First Fool". ===Shakespearean jesters=== {{Main|Shakespearean fool}} The [[Shakespearean fool]] is a recurring character type in the works of [[William Shakespeare]]. Shakespearean fools are usually clever peasants or commoners that use their wits to outdo people of higher social standing. In this sense, they are very similar to the real [[fool (stock character)|fool]]s, and jesters of the time, but their characteristics are greatly heightened for theatrical effect.{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=81oZXMaib6IC&pg=PA139&dq=gravediggers++hamlet#PPA17,M1 |title=The fools of Shakespeare: an ... - Frederick B. Warde - Google Boeken |publisher=Books.google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-24}} The "groundlings" (theatre-goers who were too poor to pay for seats and thus stood on the 'ground' in the front by the stage) that frequented the Globe Theatre were more likely to be drawn to these Shakespearean fools. However they were also favoured by the nobility. Most notably, Queen Elizabeth I was a great admirer of the popular actor who portrayed fools, [[Richard Tarlton]]. For Shakespeare himself, however, actor [[Robert Armin]] may have proved vital to the cultivation of the fool character in his many plays.{{cite web|url=http://www.foolsforhire.com/info/history.html |title=History of the Fool |publisher=Foolsforhire.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-24}} ==Modern usage== [[File:PuckCover.jpg|thumb|left|upright|American lawyer and politician [[Roscoe Conkling]] depicted as a jester in an 1884 cartoon.]] ===Buffoon=== In a similar vein, a '''buffoon''' is someone who provides amusement through inappropriate appearance or behavior. Originally the term was used to describe a ridiculous but amusing person. The term is now frequently used in a derogatory sense to describe someone considered foolish, or someone displaying inappropriately vulgar, bumbling or ridiculous behavior that is a source of general amusement. The term originates from the old Italian "buffare", meaning to puff out one's cheeks{{cite book|page=780|title=Encyclopædia Britannica; or A Dictionary of Arts, Sciences, and Miscellaneous Literature, Volume 4|publisher=Archibald Constable and Company|date=1823}} that also applies to [[bouffon]]. ===Carnival and medieval reenactment=== [[File:VSAN Wgt 2015 476 Markdorf.jpg|thumb|upright|Jester in [[Weingarten, Württemberg|Weingarten]], Germany, in 2015]] Today, the jester is portrayed in different formats of [[medieval reenactment]] and [[entertainment]], including [[film]], [[Stage (theatre)|stage]] performance, and [[carnival]]. During the Burgundian and the [[Rhenish]] [[carnival in the Netherlands|carnival]], cabaret performances in local dialect are held. In [[North Brabant|Brabant]] this person is called a "tonpraoter" or "sauwelaar", and is actually in or on a barrel. In [[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]] they are named "buuttereedner" or "buutteredner" and in [[Zeeland]] they are called an "ouwoer". They all perform a cabaret speech in dialect, during which many current issues are reviewed. Often there are local situations and celebrities from local and regional politics who are mocked, ridiculed and insulted. The "Tonpraoter" or "Buuttereedner" may be considered successors of the jesters.{{cite web|author=Home Kalender Nieuws Zoekertjes Albums Copyright |url=http://www.fenvlaanderen.be/carnaval/wat-carnaval |title=Wat is carnaval? | Fen Vlaanderen |publisher=Fenvlaanderen.be |date= |accessdate=2014-01-23}} ==Notable jesters== ===Historical=== * [[Tom le Fol]] (c. 13th century) was the 1st resident jester of [[Conwy]], [[North Wales]] and personal jester to [[Edward I]]. * [[Triboulet]] (1479–1536), court jester of Kings Louis XII and Francis I of France. * [[Stańczyk]] (c. 1480–1560), Polish jester. * [[João de Sá Panasco]] ([[Floruit|fl]]. 1524-1567), African court jester of King [[John III of Portugal]], eventually elevated to gentleman courtier of the Royal Household and [[Military Order of Saint James of the Sword|Knight of St. James]]. * [[Will Sommers]] (died 1560), court jester of King [[Henry VIII of England]]. * [[Chicot]] (c. 1540–1591), court jester of King [[Henry III of France]]. * [[Archibald Armstrong]] (died 1672), jester of King [[James I of England]]. * [[Jeffrey Hudson]] (1619–c. 1682), "court dwarf" of [[Henrietta Maria of France]]. * [[Jamie Fleeman]] (1713–1778), the Laird of Udny's Fool. * [[Perkeo of Heidelberg]], 18th century, jester of Prince [[Charles III Philip, Elector Palatine]]. Kurenai Densetsu | director = Takaomi Kanasaki | producer = | writer = [[Makoto Uezu]] | music = Masato Kōda | studio = [[J.C.Staff]] | licensee = | released = 2019 | runtime = }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{nihongo|'''''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World!'''''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o!|literally "A blessing to this wonderful world!"|lead=yes}} is a Japanese [[light novel]] series written by Natsume Akatsuki. The series follows a boy who is sent to a fantasy world following his death, forming a dysfunctional party with a goddess, a wizard, and a crusader to fight against monsters. Beginning as a [[web novel]] series published on ''[[Shousetsuka ni Narou]]'' between December 2012 and October 2013, the series was revised into a printed [[light novel]] series with illustrations by Kurone Mishima, which began publication under [[Kadokawa Shoten]]'s ''[[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]]'' [[Imprint (trade name)|Imprint]] from October 2013. A [[manga]] adaptation, illustrated by Masahito Watari and Joseph Yokobori, began serialization in [[Fujimi Shobo]]'s ''[[Monthly Dragon Age]]'' magazine from October 2014. A radio [[drama CD]] was released by HobiRecords in March 2015, and an [[anime]] television adaptation by [[Studio Deen]] aired in Japan between January and March 2016. A second season of the anime aired between January and March 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-03-16/konosuba-anime-gets-2nd-season/.99855|title=KonoSuba Anime Gets 2nd Season|date=March 16, 2016|website=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=March 16, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://nagamedigital.com/2016/11/14/konosuba-season-2-release-date/|title=KONOSUBA SEASON 2 GETS OFFICIAL RELEASE DATE, PV AND KEY VISUAL|date=November 14, 2016 |website=nagamedigital.com|accessdate=November 14, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/daily-briefs/2016-06-24/konosuba-tv-anime-2nd-season-premieres-in-january/.103579 |title=KonoSuba TV Anime's 2nd Season Premieres in January |date=June 24, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=June 24, 2016 }} A spin-off light novel series, ''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen o!'', began publication from July 2014. Both the light novels and the manga are licensed in North America by [[Yen Press]]. An anime film adaptation by [[J.C.Staff]] titled ''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Kurenai Densetsu'' will premiere in 2019. ==Plot== {{See also|List of KonoSuba characters}} Following an untimely and embarrassing death, Kazuma Satō, a Japanese teenager [[hikikomori|shut-in]] [[NEET]], meets a goddess named Aqua, who offers to reincarnate him in a [[parallel universe (fiction)|parallel world]] with [[Massively multiplayer online role-playing game|MMORPG]] elements, where he can go on adventures and battle monsters. Despite being offered a superpowered item or ability to use in this new world, Kazuma, following some provocation, chooses Aqua herself to accompany him to the town of Axel, quickly finding her absent-mindedness to be less than beneficial.{{ref|LN|LN 1.P}} With Aqua unable to return to the afterlife until the [[Dark Lord (fiction)|Devil King]] is defeated, the two form a [[Party (role-playing games)|party]] and recruit two other members; an explosion-obsessed magician named Megumin and a masochistic crusader named Darkness.{{ref|LN|LN 1.2.4}} Due to the party's dysfunctional abilities, Kazuma quickly gives up on the idea of defeating the Devil King and tries to live a luxurious lifestyle, only to find the circumstances of his daily life are forcing him and his party to encounter and battle the Devil King's generals.{{ref|LN|LN 2.3}} ==Media== ===Novels=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba volumes#Light novels}} The original [[web novel]] series written by Natsume Akatsuki was published on Syosetu between December 2012 and October 2013.{{cite web| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131127132412/http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| archivedate=November 27, 2013| url=http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| title=KonoSuba web novel| publisher=Syosetu| language=Japanese| accessdate=February 8, 2016}} The author also wrote a side story featuring [[#Wiz|Wiz]] and Vanir.{{cite web| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130729143507/http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7364bo/| archivedate=July 29, 2013| url=http://ncode.syosetu.com/n7145bl/| title=The Masked Demon's Dream Watching| publisher=Syosetu| language=Japanese| accessdate=February 8, 2016}} Akatsuki, who enjoyed playing fantasy video games like ''[[Wizardry]]'' and ''[[Final Fantasy]]'', also derived much of ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} fantasy elements from [[tabletop role-playing game]]s.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/04/26-1/the-anime-man-interviews-konosuba-creator|title=The Anime Man Interviews "Konosuba" Creator|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=April 26, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} A [[light novel]] version with illustrations by Kurone Mishima began release under [[Kadokawa Shoten]]'s [[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]] [[Imprint (trade name)|imprint]] from October 1, 2013,{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321307000151| script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！| publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]| accessdate=May 30, 2015| language=Japanese}} with thirteen volumes released as of December 1, 2017.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321706000257| script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に祝福を!13| publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]| accessdate=January 20, 2018| language=Japanese}} The light novel diverges significantly from the web novel's plot from the sixth volume onwards,{{citation needed|date=August 2017}} and also features changes to the characters' ages. A Megumin-focused [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] light novel series, also written and illustrated by Akatsuki and Mishima respectively, titled {{nihongo3|lit. "Give Explosions to This Wonderful World!"|この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!}} and takes place a year prior to the main series, began release from July 1, 2014, with three volumes released as of June 1, 2015.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321403000163|script-title=ja:この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=June 6, 2015|language=Japanese}} A sequel novel was released December 28, 2016,{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321607000363 |script-title=ja:続・この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！ |publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]] |accessdate=February 11, 2017 |language=Japanese}} named {{nihongo3|lit. "Sequel: Give Explosions to This Wonderful World!"|続・この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を！|Zoku: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!}}. Another spin-off featuring Vanir was published on April 1, 2016, called {{nihongo3|lit. "Consulting with the Masked Devil!"|この仮面の悪魔に相談を！|Kono Kamen no Akuma ni Sōdan wo!}}.{{cite web| url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321601000557|script-title=ja:この仮面の悪魔に相談を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=June 30, 2016|language=Japanese}} Written by Hirukuma and illustrated by Uihime Hagure, a third spin-off is published since August 1, 2017, it is titled {{nihongo3|lit. "Bless Me in This Wonderful World! Extra: Attention Also to That Fool!"|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！|Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo! Extra Ano Orokamono ni mo Kyakkou wo!}}.{{cite web|url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321703000426|title=この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=January 29, 2018|language=Japanese}} The second volume was released on December 1, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://sneakerbunko.jp/bookdetails/index.php?pcd=321703000427|title=この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！エクストラ あの愚か者にも脚光を！2|publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]]|accessdate=January 29, 2018|language=Japanese}} [[Yen Press]] announced on May 20, 2016 that it had licensed the light novels for release in North America.{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-05-20/yen-press-licenses-konosuba-death-march-to-the-parallel-world-rhapsody-manga-light-novels/.102332 |title=Yen Press Licenses Konosuba, Death March to the Parallel World Rhapsody Manga, Light Novels |date=May 20, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=May 20, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170702032320/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-05-20/yen-press-licenses-konosuba-death-march-to-the-parallel-world-rhapsody-manga-light-novels/.102332|archivedate=July 2, 2017}} The first volume was released in conjunction with the second manga volume on February 21, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://yenpress.com/2017/02/konosuba-gods-blessing-on-this-hilariously-frustrating-world/|title=Konosuba: God's Blessing on This Hilariously Frustrating World|work=[[Yen Press]]|date=February 21, 2017|accessdate=August 27, 2017}} ===Manga=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba volumes#Manga}} A [[manga]] adaption of ''KonoSuba'' illustrated by Masahito Watari began serialization in the October 2014 issue of [[Fujimi Shobo]]'s ''[[Monthly Dragon Age]]'' magazine on September 9, 2014.{{cite web| url=http://natalie.mu/comic/news/125663| title=''Omamori Himari'', Milan Matra's New Series| publisher=[[Natalie (website)|Natalie]]| date=September 9, 2014| accessdate=October 30, 2015| language=Japanese}} Five ''tankōbon'' volumes have been released as of March 2017. A spin-off manga, ''A Spotlight For (Even) This fool! Gifting this Wonderful World with Blessings! Extra'', was released as a bundle with the twelfth light novel volume. Written and illustrated by [[Kuma Hiru]] and [[Hagure Yuki]], respectively, it follows the story of Dust, who finds himself in trouble with Vanir over selling stolen products.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/06/16/konosuba-anticipates-humiliation-a-new-ova-and-cover-previews|title="Konosuba" Anticipates Humiliation, a New OVA and Cover Previews|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=June 16, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} Yen Press announced its acquisition of the manga adaptation at the same time that it licensed the original light novels. ===Anime=== {{See also|List of KonoSuba episodes}} An [[anime]] television adaptation by [[Studio Deen]]{{cite web| url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-05-25/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-alternate-world-comedy-light-novels-get-tv-anime/.88540| title=''KonoSuba'' TV Anime Announcement| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| date=May 25, 2015| accessdate=May 25, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170626203637/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-05-25/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-alternate-world-comedy-light-novels-get-tv-anime/.88540|archivedate=June 26, 2017}} aired on [[Tokyo MX]] between January 14, 2016, and March 16, 2016;{{cite web| url=https://konosuba.com/onair/| title=''KonoSuba'' Network Information| publisher=KonoSuba.com| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 29, 2016|quote=TOKYO MX – 1月13日より毎週水曜 – 25:05 ～ 25:35}} later broadcasting on eight other networks and several [[video on demand]] [[streaming media|streaming networks]]. The series was simulcast by [[Crunchyroll]] in several regions such as North America,{{cite web| url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-01-12/crunchyroll-to-stream-konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime/.97499| title=Crunchyroll to Stream KonoSuba| date=January 12, 2016| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=February 1, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170728231301/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-01-12/crunchyroll-to-stream-konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime/.97499|archivedate=July 28, 2017}} and by [[AnimeLab]] in Australia.{{cite web| url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-22/new-titles-for-animelab-2016-winter-simulcast-season/.96781| title=New Titles for AnimeLab 2016 Winter Simulcast Season| date=December 21, 2015| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=February 8, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170729011400/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-22/new-titles-for-animelab-2016-winter-simulcast-season/.96781|archivedate=July 29, 2017}} The series was directed by Takaomi Kanasaki and written by [[Makoto Uezu]] with character designs by Koichi Kikuta. An [[original video animation]] (OVA) was bundled with the ninth light novel of ''KonoSuba'' in June 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-21/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-light-novel-bundles-original-anime-blu-ray/.96791| title=''KonoSuba'' Light Novel Bundles Original Anime Blu-ray| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| date=December 21, 2015| accessdate=December 21, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170726160432/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-12-21/kono-subarashii-sekai-ni-shukufuku-o-light-novel-bundles-original-anime-blu-ray/.96791|archivedate=July 26, 2017}} The anime's opening theme is "Fantastic Dreamer" by [[Machico (singer)|Machico]] while the ending theme is {{nihongo|"Chīsana Bōken-sha"|ちいさな冒険者||lit."Little Adventurer"}} performed by [[Sora Amamiya]], [[Rie Takahashi]], and [[Ai Kayano]].{{cite web| url=http://konosuba.com/staff_cast/| title=KonoSuba anime staff| publisher=KonoSuba.com| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 31, 2016}} The series was animated by Koichi Kikuta and Momoka Komatsu, with the former working on odd-numbered episodes and the latter on even-numbered. While Komatsu's character designs closely resembled those of the light novels and had more attractive appearances, Kikuta based his designs on children's shows like ''[[Pokémon (anime)|Pokémon]]'' as he felt ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} story was similar to those found in such shows. A second season premiered on January 12, 2017. The second season's opening theme is "Tomorrow" by Machico, and the ending theme is {{nihongo|"Ouchi ni Kaeritai"|お家に帰りたい||lit."Want to Go Home"}} by Amamiya, Takahashi, and Kayano.{{cite web|title=KonoSuba 2 Anime's Promo Video Previews Machico's Opening Theme|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-12/konosuba-2-anime-promo-video-previews-machico-opening-theme/.109782|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=December 13, 2016|date=December 12, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170731160957/https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-12/konosuba-2-anime-promo-video-previews-machico-opening-theme/.109782|archivedate=July 31, 2017}} A second OVA was bundled with the twelfth volume of ''KonoSuba'' in July 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-26/konosuba-light-novel-to-bundle-original-anime-blu-ray/.110350|title=KonoSuba Light Novel to Bundle Original Anime Blu-ray|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=December 26, 2016|accessdate=December 26, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170731004431/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-12-26/konosuba-light-novel-to-bundle-original-anime-blu-ray/.110350|archivedate=July 31, 2017}} On July 25, 2017, [[Jun Fukushima]] and Takahashi, the voice actors of Kazuma and Megumin respectively, announced plans for a new ''KonoSuba'' anime project.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2017-07-25/konosuba-comedy-fantasy-anime-gets-new-anime-project/.119285 |title=KonoSuba Comedy Fantasy Anime Gets New Anime Project |date=July 25, 2017 |website=[[Anime News Network]] |accessdate=January 20, 2018 }}{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/07/25-1/new-konosuba-anime-project-announced|title=New "Konosuba" Anime Project Announced|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=July 25, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} On October 6, 2018, it was announced that characters from ''KonoSuba'' would appear in ''[[Isekai Quartet]]'', a crossover anime also featuring characters from ''[[Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World]]'', ''[[Overlord (novel series)|Overlord]]'', and ''[[The Saga of Tanya the Evil]]''.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2018-10-06/new-isekai-quartet-anime-project-crosses-over-overlord-re-zero-tanya-konosuba-franchises/.137803 |title=New Isekai Quartet Anime Project Crosses Over Overlord, Re:Zero, Tanya, Konosuba Franchises |date=October 6, 2018 |website=Anime News Network |accessdate=October 14, 2018 }} ===Video games=== A PC [[video game]] developed by game creator Tachi, titled {{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! In The Life''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！in the life}}, is bundled with the first Blu-ray Disc/DVD volume of the anime series on March 25, 2016.{{cite web |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-02-13/konosuba-1st-blu-ray-dvd-to-include-pc-game/.98637 |title=KonoSuba's 1st Blu-ray/DVD to Include PC Game |date=February 13, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170802002325/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-02-13/konosuba-1st-blu-ray-dvd-to-include-pc-game/.98637|archivedate=August 2, 2017}} The game is developed using the software [[RPG Maker VX]].{{cite web|title=Blu-ray限定版&DVD限定版　第1巻　超豪華5大特典！！|url=http://konosuba.com/1st/bd/?mode=detail&id=bd1|website=アニメ『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！』公式サイト|publisher=Kadokawa Corporation|accessdate=August 21, 2016|language=Japanese}} Another video game, created by Team Ladybug and Krobon, titled ''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World! Revival of Beldia'' ({{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Fukatsu no Verdier''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！復活のベルディア}}) is bundled with the limited edition of first Blu-ray Disc/DVD volume of the anime series' second season and was released on April 28, 2017.{{cite web|title=「この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！２」 Blu-ray & DVD 第1巻|url=http://konosuba.com/bd/?mode=detail&id=bd1|website=アニメ『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！2』公式サイト|accessdate=March 30, 2017|language=Japanese}} The game is a [[side-scrolling video game|side-scroller]] with gameplay resembling the ''[[Mega Man (video game)|Mega Man]]'' series.{{cite web|url=https://www.siliconera.com/2017/02/01/konosubas-season-2-limited-blu-ray-bonus-sweet-mega-man-style-side-scroller/|title=KonoSuba's Season 2 Limited Blu-ray Bonus Is A Sweet Mega Man-Style Side-Scroller|publisher=Siliconera|date=February 1, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} A visual novel adaptation for [[PlayStation Vita]] and [[PlayStation 4]], ''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World! Judgment on this Greedy Game!'' ({{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! -Kono Yokubukai Game ni Shinpan o!-''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！ -この欲深いゲームに審判を！-}}), was developed by [[5pb.]], published by [[Ubisoft]] and was released in Japan on September 7, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.siliconera.com/2017/05/10/konosubas-new-game-releases-september-7-japan-comes-bonus-konosuba-shooting-game/v|title=KonoSuba's New Game Releases September 7 In Japan, Comes With Bonus KonoSuba Shooting Game|work=Siliconera|date=May 10, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} The game features an original story, in which Kazuma discovers a cursed ring that allows him to steal the underwear of others near him. He learns the only way to undo the curse would be through raising enough money. ''Judgment on this Greedy Game!'' introduces an "Underwear Judgment" system, where the player assists Kazuma in returning lost underwear to their rightful owner.{{cite web|last=Romano|first=Sal|title=KonoSuba game launches for PS4 and PS Vita this summer in Japan|url=https://gematsu.com/2017/03/konosuba-game-launches-ps4-ps-vita-summer-japan|publisher=Gematsu|accessdate=March 30, 2017}} Like the anime, Machico performed the opening ("Million Smile"), while Amamiya, Takahashi, and Kayano sang the game's ending theme ("101 Pikime no Hitsuji").{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/07/23/hear-cast-and-machico-sing-konosuba-game-themes|title=Hear Cast And Machico Sing "Konosuba" Game Themes|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=July 23, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} ===Film=== On June 25, 2018, a film adaptation titled was announced to be in development at [[J.C.Staff]]. The cast and staff are set to reprise their roles from the TV series.{{cite web |last1=Hodgkins |first1=Crystalyn |title=Konosuba - God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! Anime Gets Film Project |url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2018-06-25/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime-gets-film-project/.133376 |website=Anime News Network |accessdate=June 25, 2018 |date=June 25, 2018}} The film is titled {{nihongo|''Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku o! Kurenai Densetsu''|この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！紅伝説}},{{cite web |title=『この素晴らしい世界に祝福を！紅伝説』ティザービジュアル公開！ |url=https://konosuba.com/2nd/news/?mode=detail&id=20181104_1 |publisher=[[Kadokawa Corporation]] |accessdate=November 5, 2018 |language=Japanese |date=November 5, 2018}} and is scheduled to premiere in 2019.{{cite web|last1=Hodgkins |first1=Crystalyn|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/daily-briefs/2018-10-20/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-anime-film-opens-in-2019/.138430|title=KONOSUBA - God's blessing on this wonderful world! Anime Film Opens in 2019|date=October 20, 2018|publisher=Anime News Network|accessdate=October 20, 2018}} ===Other media=== A radio [[drama CD]], featuring a different voice cast to the anime, was released by HobiRecords on March 1, 2015.{{cite web| url=https://www.toranoana.jp/info/dojin/konosuba/| title=KonoSuba Drama CD| publisher=[[Comic Toranoana]]| language=Japanese| accessdate=January 29, 2016}} A second drama CD, along with an original soundtrack by [[Kouda Masato]] and a [[character song]] album, was released in March 2017.{{cite web|url=https://otakumode.com/news/5891ab30e088942e19129b4f/March-Is-KonoSuba-Month-New-Original-Soundtrack-Drama-CD-Character-Song-Album-Slated-for-Release!|title=March Is KonoSuba Month - New Original Soundtrack, Drama CD & Character Song Album Slated for Release!|work=Tokyo Otaku Mode News|date=February 2, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} ==Reception== The ''KonoSuba'' light novels have been quite popular. As of March 2, 2016, the 11-volume series has a total of 1.5 million copies in print, each volume selling 136,000 copies.{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2016/03/02/konosuba-novel-sales-increases-three-times-thanks-to-tv-anime|title='KonoSuba' Novel Sales Increases Three Times Thanks to TV Anime|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=March 2, 2016|first=Mikikazu|last=Komatsu}} As of February 2017, the light novels had three million copies in print.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=https://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/02/03/konosuba-art-book-commercial-explodes-online|title="Konosuba" Art Book Commercial Explodes Online|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 3, 2017|accessdate=August 26, 2017}} In a review of the first novel, Andy Hanley praised the series' comedy reflected in the "tired genre" as well as its cast finding them appealing based on their traits. However, Hanley criticized the short length of the first volume.{{cite web |url=http://www.uk-anime.net/manga/Konosuba:_God's_Blessing_on_This_Wonderful_World!_-_Vol._1_(Light_novel).html |title=MANGA REVIEW: Konosuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! - Vol. 1 (Light novel) |last=Hanley |first=Andy|date=February 28, 2017 |website=UK Anime|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} The series won [[BookWalker]]'s 2016 Grand Prix Award.{{cite web|last=Komatsu|first=Mikizaku|url=https://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/02/03/konosuba-gods-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-wins-book-walker-grand-prix-award-2016|title="KONOSUBA -God's blessing on this wonderful world!" Wins Book Walker Grand Prix Award 2016|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 3, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} {{quote box|align=right|width=25em|quote=''KonoSuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World'' is an anime that has a lot of fun mocking the tropes of the typical JRPG fantasy world via a colorful cast of characters that are enjoyable in their own right. The comedy is so spot-on with its deadpan nature that it's hard not to be drawn in by that alone.|source=– Richard Eisenbeis, in his review of the anime}} Like its light novel counterpart, the anime has received positive reception for its comedy, parody of the "trapped in a fantasy world" subgenre, and faithful adaptation of the light novels. Reviewing the first few episodes, [[Anime News Network]] (ANN)'s Theron Martin described the second episode as "the funniest episode of anime I have seen since ''[[Monthly Girls' Nozaki-kun]]'' aired", while also praising the series' musical score.{{cite web |url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world/episodes-1-2/.97800 |title=KonoSuba – God's blessing on this wonderful world!! Episodes 1-2 |last=Martin |first=Theron |date=January 21, 2016 |website=[[Anime News Network]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170802104838/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world/episodes-1-2/.97800|archivedate=August 2, 2017}} The voice acting has also been a subject of praise; Nick Creamer of ANN commended Sora Amamiya and Rie Takahashi's roles as Aqua and Megumin for the energy provided in their performances, while Martin applauded Jun Fukushima for his work in voicing Kazuma, considering his dry tone an additional factor in the show's humor.{{cite web|last=Martin|first=Theron|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-2/episode-7/.112580|title=KONOSUBA - God's blessing on this wonderful world! 2 - Episode 7|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=February 23, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017|quote=Week in and week out, Jun Fukushima knocks it out of the park with his perfectly-measured rendition of Kazuma. In every scene, his inflection and tone is exactly right to milk the maximum value out of a scene's comedy potential. ... The female seiyuu are nailing their roles too, but many scenes in this series wouldn't be half as funny without Kazuma's dry wit as the slightly-less-crazy center of a crazy maelstrom.}} In contrast, a common criticism of the anime was its inconsistent character animation, one that was described as "low budget" as characters appeared [[off-model]].{{cite web|last=Morrissy|first=Kim|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2017/02/27-1/feature-novel-vs-anime-konosuba|title=FEATURE: Novel vs Anime - "Konosuba"|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=February 27, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} Koichi Kikuta responded by stating such design was intentional, hoping to "bring out the individuality of each character" rather than the prettier artwork in the light novels; to do this, Kikuta's animation displayed "their more human sides, like their unflattering traits and their distressed moments."{{cite web|url=https://wavemotioncannon.com/2017/02/07/konosuba-interview-with-koichi-kikuta-anime-style-009-july-2016/|title=Konosuba Interview with Koichi Kikuta (Anime Style 009, July 2016)|work=Wave Motion Cannon|date=February 7, 2017|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} [[Crunchyroll]]'s Kim Morrissy considered the animation to be humorous, especially fitting in a comedic anime. [[Kotaku]] writer Richard Eisenbeis explained much of the series' humor derives from the deconstruction of Kazuma's hopes of becoming the hero of a fantasy world, instead realizing he is forced to struggle his way through the world.{{cite web|last=Eisenbeis|first=Richard|url=https://kotaku.com/when-your-new-life-in-a-jrpg-world-doesn-t-live-up-to-e-1778353269|title=When Your New Life in a JRPG World Doesn't Live Up to Expectations|publisher=[[Kotaku]]|date=May 26, 2016|accessdate=August 25, 2017}} Comparing Kazuma's problems in a fantasy world to those in real life, Creamer wrote about a sense of relatability between the series' protagonists and the audience, as the party deals with issues like debt and taking questionable jobs because of high pay. On a critical note, Creamer disapproved of Kazuma's negative attitude, which he felt harmed the comedy in the series.{{cite web|last=Creamer|first=Nick|url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/review/konosuba-god-blessing-on-this-wonderful-world-episodes-1-10-streaming/.100209|title=KonoSuba – God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! [Episodes 1-10 Streaming]|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|date=March 25, 2016|accessdate=August 30, 2017}} ''KonoSuba''{{'s}} characters, especially those in Kazuma's party, have gained favorable thoughts in the anime community. Creamer described the group as possessing a "strange but endearing chemistry," as the members are unfriendly with one another, yet are close. Morrissy added the party's "emotional bond is also evident in the ways they interact with each other. My favorite thing about the anime is that it takes the time to draw these nuances out onscreen and express them with visual flair." Megumin in particular has been considered one of the series' most popular characters, winning Sneaker Bunko's official Favorite ''KonoSuba'' Character poll.{{cite web|url=https://sneakerbunko.jp/special/konosuba-charavote/index.php|title=KonoSuba Character Poll|work=[[Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]]|accessdate=September 1, 2017|language=Japanese}} She was also the sixth-highest vote in ''[[Newtype]]''{{'s}} 2015–16 Awards for Best Female Character (Kazuma was third in the male category) and received the most "Other" votes in the Best Girl category in [[Crunchyroll]]'s Anime Awards 2016.{{cite web|last=Green|first=Scott|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2016/10/09/japanese-fans-pick-favorite-anime-from-last-twelve-months-in-newtype-awards|title=Japanese Fans Pick Favorite Anime From Last Twelve Months In Newtype Awards|publisher=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=October 9, 2016|accessdate=September 1, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2017/01/10-1/feature-crunchyroll-anime-awards-the-results-are-in-see-who-won|title=FEATURE: Crunchyroll Anime Awards - The Results are In! See Who Won!|work=[[Crunchyroll]]|date=January 10, 2017|accessdate=September 1, 2017}} In an interview with internet personality The Anime Man, Natsume Akatsuki described Megumin as giving off "a pure and elegant atmosphere" like one of an anime heroine or [[waifu]], hence her popularity among fans. In 2016, the anime was voted the tenth-best TV anime in the ''Newtype'' 2015–16 Awards. ''KonoSuba'' also finished runner-up for Best Comedy in the Anime Awards 2016 to ''[[Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto]]''. ==Notes== *{{note|LN|LN}} represents the Light Novel of the series in the format of X.Y.Z, where X represents the volume, Y represents the chapter, and Z represents the part. Chapter P represents the [[prologue]] while chapter A represents the [[afterword]] of the novel. Ex. and M. refer to the ''Explosions'' (''Sekai ni Bakuen o!'') and ''Consulting with the Masked Devil'' (''Kono Kamen no Akuma ni Sōdan wo!'') spin-offs. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category|KonoSuba}} *{{Official website|https://sneakerbunko.jp/series/konosuba/}} {{ja icon}} *{{Official website|https://konosuba.com/|Official anime website}} {{ja icon}} *{{Official website|https://www.fujimishobo.co.jp/sp/201504konosuba/|Official manga website}} {{ja icon}} *{{ann|light novel|18158}} {{Konosuba}} {{Studio Deen}} {{J.C.Staff}} [[Category:2013 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2014 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2016 anime OVAs]] [[Category:2016 Japanese novels]] [[Category:2017 video games]] [[Category:Anime and manga based on light novels]] [[Category:Comedy anime and manga]] [[Category:Crunchyroll]] [[Category:Fantasy anime and manga]] [[Category:Fujimi Shobo manga]] [[Category:Isekai anime and manga]] [[Category:J.C.Staff]] [[Category:Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko]] [[Category:Kadokawa Dwango franchises]] [[Category:Light novels]] [[Category:Light novels first published online]] [[Category:Media Factory manga]] [[Category:Media franchises]] [[Category:MMORPGs in fiction]] [[Category:Monarchy in fiction]] [[Category:Novels about the afterlife]] [[Category:Reincarnation in fiction]] [[Category:Screenplays by Makoto Uezu]] [[Category:Shōsetsuka ni Narō]] [[Category:Studio Deen]] [[Category:Shōnen manga]] [[Category:Television programs based on light novels]] [[Category:Tokyo MX shows]] [[Category:Upcoming animated films]] [[Category:Visual novels]] [[Category:Yen Press titles]]
